definitions: the method of presenting a play or other dramatic performance

examples.text: the quality of staging and design
one of the better stagings of Hamlet

shortDefinitions: method of presenting play or other dramatic performance

definitions: the organizing of a public event or protest

examples.text: the fourteenth staging of the championships

shortDefinitions: organizing of public event or protest

definitions: the activity or practice of styling and furnishing a property for sale in such a way as to enhance its attractiveness to potential buyers

examples.text: home staging has become a huge trend in the real estate industry
learn how staging can help you sell faster and at a higher price point

shortDefinitions: practice of styling and furnishing property for sale to enhance its attractiveness

definitions: a stage or set of stages or temporary platforms arranged as a support for performers or between different levels of scaffolding

examples.text: pairs of ladders can be bridged with staging
men at work on high stagings

shortDefinitions: stage or set of stages or temporary platforms arranged as support for performers or between different levels of scaffolding

definitions: diagnosis or classification of the particular stage reached by a progressive disease.
shortDefinitions: diagnosis or classification of particular stage reached by progressive disease

definitions: the arrangement of stages in a rocket or spacecraft.
shortDefinitions: arrangement of stages in rocket or spacecraft

definitions: the separation and jettisoning of a stage from the remainder of a rocket when its propellant is spent.
shortDefinitions: separation and jettisoning of stage from remainder of rocket
